snippet: An unnecessary amendment intended to clarify the status of religion in public places will only erode freedoms and create confusion in schools.
abstract: Editorial contends Missouri voters should reject proposed amendment to their State Constitution that is supposed to clarify the right to prayer; argues amendment would wreak havoc in classrooms by giving students the right to opt out of assignments by claiming they offend their religious views.
lead_paragraph: An unnecessary amendment intended to clarify the status of religion in public places will only erode freedoms and create confusion in schools.
